Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #437628 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MXK05:ref - Customer is requesting update

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MXK05:ref

Hello team , do you have any updates regarding this ticket ?
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #437628 - EPP Capabilities for Monitoring/Blocking Specific Transfer Scenarios

TextBody: Hello Csilla, Here are the answers that I received from the engineers: 1. When the following command is executed: curl --upload-file file.zip https://transfer.sh/file.zip Yes (using DPI) and monitoring the curl application 2. Through a custom file server using SOCKS5 Not sure if this will work, but you can try to monitor the port of the SOCKS5 proxy using DPI and check if it works as expected To monitor the port you will have to access Content Aware Protection -> Deep Packet Inspection -> and enable the Custom Ports. 3. RDP channels No 4: SSH tunnels No Best regards, Emil --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Csilla Torok [csilla_torok@flutterint.com] Sent: 4/3/2025 3:53 PM To: techsupport@netwrix.com Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #437628 - EPP Capabilities for Monitoring/Blocking Specific Transfer Scenarios ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MXK05:ref Hello team , do you have any updates regarding this ticket ?
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437628 - EPP Capabilities for Monitoring/Blocking Specific Transfer Scenarios    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MXK05:ref ]

TextBody: ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MXK05:ref Hello Emil, Thanks for your reply. However, I noticed that the SSH option is enabled in the EPP, even though you mentioned that the tool doesn't support SSH Tunnel. Can you please clarify this? [cid:image001.png@01DBA558.A76E4B50] Thank you! TextBody: Hello Csilla, This is for the windows policy only and you can monitor "WinSCP/SCP/SFTP/SSH" from the "Social Media / Others" in order to report/block confidential files accessed by certain "SSH" programs such as "Putty", SCP, SFTP, SSH (provided with software such as cygwin, msys2, mingw). Best regards, Emil --------------- Original Message --------------- From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com] Sent: 4/4/2025 9:00 PM To: csilla_torok@flutterint.com Cc: oana.nemes@netwrix.com Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437628 - EPP Capabilities for Monitoring/Blocking Specific Transfer Scenarios [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MXK05:ref ] Hello Csilla, I asked internally and I will get back to you with some more details Monday.
